comment.text: This translation key is used for the placeholder text "Enter new email" in various input fields within the application, typically in forms or dialogs where users are required to enter a new email address.

usage.context:
<StyledBodyContent>
 <Text className="text-body">{t("EmailActivationDescription")}</Text>
 <FieldContainer
 isVertical
 style={{ margin: "0" }}
 // labelText={t("EnterEmail")}
 errorMessage={errorMessage}
 hasError={hasError}
 labelVisible={false}
 >
 <EmailInput

<StyledBodyContent>

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Въведете нов имейл адрес" is a bit verbose for a label like 'Enter new email'. A more concise and natural translation might be preferred in UI contexts.
The translation 'Escriba una nueva dirección de email' is overly formal. A more natural and conversational translation would be preferred.
While technically correct, 'Entrer une nouvelle adresse email' is a bit verbose and formal for a dialog label. A more natural and concise translation would be better.

The translation 'Մուտքագրեք նոր էլփոստի հասցե' literally translates to 'Enter new email address'. While understandable, 'Enter new email' is more concise and aligns better with the English prompt, especially in a dialog box context.  The added 'հասցե' (address) is unnecessary and clutters the phrase.
The translation "新しいメールアドレスの入力" is too literal and formal for a dialog label like "Enter new email". It translates to "Input of new email address".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 新しいメールアドレスを入力

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Japanese translation is a full sentence. Dialog labels are typically short and concise.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 新しいメールアドレス

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Inserir um novo endereço de e-mail" is a bit verbose and formal for a dialog prompt. A more natural and concise translation would be better.
The translation "නව වි-තැපෑල යොදන්න" while understandable, is not the most natural way to say 'Enter new email' in Sinhala. It's overly literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural translation would be "නව විද්‍යාත්මක ලිපිනය ඇතුළත් කරන්න" or simply "විද්‍යාත්මක ලිපිනය ඇතුළත් කරන්න" (Enter email address).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'වි-තැපෑල' (vi-tapeela) is sometimes used, it's less common than just 'විද්‍යාත්මක' (vidyātamika) for 'email'.

While technically correct, 'Vnesite email naslov' is a more formal and literal translation of 'Enter new email'. A more natural and user-friendly translation would be something like 'Vnesite novo elektronsko pošto' or 'Vnesite novo e-mail naslov'.

The translation "Унеси нови емаил" uses "емаил" which is a direct transliteration of "email" and not a natural Serbian word. While understood, it's not ideal. A more natural translation would be "Унеси нову електронску пошту" or "Унеси нову е-маил адресу".

The translation 'Unesi novi email' is a literal translation and doesn't sound natural in Serbian. 'Unesi' is more appropriate for entering data into a field manually. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'Novo email' or 'Unesite novu email adresu'.
